headline: my name is keagan
subheading: i maintain web apps using javascript, perl and other technologies. this site contains links to my projects, and my profiles on github and linkedin

projects.title: shelf talker
projects.description: A Svelte app to generate shelf talkers for use at The Wine Merchant in Baltimore, Maryland. All processing is done client-side, and uses HTML2Canvas to create data URLs to export the generated shelf talkers.

projects.title: incipiam
projects.description: Using bash and launchd, this script launches and closes certain processes when I connect my Mac to my USB-C monitor.

projects.title: breezy
projects.description: class-less css framework for use with bike-to-html

open-source-contributions.title: bike-converters
open-source-contributions.description: Adding support for different row types in a tool that converts outlines from the Bike app to markdown

about.title: work experience
about.text: I am currently working at ECS Tuning, an e-commerce platform for german auto parts. I am a full stack engineer on the customer facing team. Each day I use Perl, Template Toolkit 2, JQuery and a little bit of SQL. Before taking the software engineering role, I was also a QA engineer and a customer service rep at the same company! Visit my LinkedIn profile to see more about my professional skills.

about.title: off the clock
about.description: I usually like to read newer fiction, manga, and sometimes philosophy. I also love bike rides and hikes when the weather permits. When it comes to video games I enjoy roguelikes, sim racing, and FPS games such as Borderlands or Left For Dead.
